Definition: In this task, you are given the body of a document and a title. The title might have some text in parentheses, for example: "HMS Mallow (K81)", or be slightly different from what is present in the text. Your task is to determine whether the title is correct. A correct title is one that refers to the same entity as the text. Output "Yes" if the title is correct, otherwise output "No".

Positive Examples.input:
Text: The Mansfield Building Society is a UK building society which has its headquarters in Mansfield Nottinghamshire. It is a member of the Building Societies Association. 
Title: Mansfield Building Society
Positive Examples.explanation: The title "Mansfield Building Society" is present in the text and it is the main entity that is referred in the text. Hence, it is the title of the document.

Positive Examples.input:
Text:  The third and current HMS Argyll is a Type 23 'Duke' Class frigate. She is currently the oldest serving Type 23 frigate in the Royal Navy. Like all of her class she is named for a British dukedom in this case that of Argyll. 
Title: HMS Argyll (F231)
Positive Examples.explanation: "HMS Argyll" is present in the text and it is the main entity that is referred in the text. Here, the text in parentheses "F31" is not present in the document and it can be ignored. Hence, the output is correct.

Negative Examples.input:
Text: The Mansfield Building Society is a UK building society which has its headquarters in Mansfield Nottinghamshire. It is a member of the Building Societies Association. 
Title: Mansfield Building Society
Negative Examples.explanation: The title "Mansfield Building Society" is present in the text and it is the main entity that is referred in the text. Hence, the output is incorrect.

Negative Examples.input:
Text:  The third and current HMS Argyll is a Type 23 'Duke' Class frigate. She is currently the oldest serving Type 23 frigate in the Royal Navy. Like all of her class she is named for a British dukedom in this case that of Argyll. 
Title: HMS Argyll (F231)
Negative Examples.explanation: The output should be either "Yes" or "No". Hence, it is negative example.

Instances.input:
Text:  A Curious Dream is a 1907 short drama film based on Mark Twain's short story The Curious Dream. Twain himself provided the following testimonial: Gentlemen: I authorize the Vitagraph Company of America to make a moving picture from my 'Curious Dream.' I have their picture of John Barter examining his gravestone and find it frightfully and deliciously humorous. 
Title: Eliksir

Text:  Tibiscus University of Timişoara is an accredited university in Timişoara Romania. It was established in 1991 and accredited by Law 484/11.07.2002.More precisely it has 14 accredited or temporarily authorized license (Bachelor's) curricula according to Government Decision no. 749/2009 and 10 accredited or temporarily authorized Master's curricula according to Order no. 4360/2010 of the Romanian Department of Education. 
Title: American School of The Hague

Text:  The Tongaland cannibal snail scientific name Natalina wesseliana is a species of medium-sized predatory air-breathing land snail carnivorous terrestrial pulmonate gastropod mollusc in the family Rhytididae. This species is endemic to South Africa and is named after the natural region of Tongaland. Its natural habitat is temperate forests. It is threatened by habitat loss. 
Title: Tongaland cannibal snail

Text:  USS William M. Hobby (APD-95) ex-DE-236 was a United States Navy high-speed transport in commission from 1945 to 1946. 
Title: USS William M. Hobby (APD-95)

Text:  Bear Mountain Indian Mission School is a historic Native American missionary school in Amherst Virginia.The school was used by the Monacan tribe since: [i]n 1868 [when] a parcel of land was donated for a meeting place for the Indian people. At the time churches and schools were provided for whites and for blacks but not for Indians. Originally a wooden arbor served as the meeting place and itinerant ministers began to hold Baptist and Methodist services there. 
Title: Bear Mountain Indian Mission School

Text:  MS Volendam is an R-Class cruise ship belonging to Holland America Line. There are ten decks with passenger cabins spread across five of them. The ship contains eight bars two swimming pools two hot tubs a spa and a show lounge. The theme aboard Volendam is flowers and fresh displays are located in abundance on board the ship; décor throughout the ship also emphasize floral patterns. 
Title: MS Volendam

Text:  Secrets of the Lamp is an accessory for the 2nd edition of the Advanced Dungeons & Dragons fantasy role-playing game published in 1993. 
Title: Secrets of the Lamp

Text:  Cinder Cone is a cinder cone volcano in Lassen Volcanic National Park (located in Northern California in the United States). It is located about 10 miles (16 km) northeast of Lassen Peak and provides an excellent view of Brokeoff Mountain Lassen Peak and Chaos Crags. The cone was built to a height of 750 feet (230 m) above the surrounding area and spread ash over 30 square miles (78 km2). Then like many cinder cones it was snuffed out when several basalt lava flows erupted from its base. 
Title: Cinder Cone and the Fantastic Lava Beds
